epic.title: Performance & Scalability
epic.summary: Comprehensive performance and scalability framework ensuring fast response times, high throughput, and elastic scaling to support growing healthcare operations and user demands.
epic.businessOverview: Comprehensive performance and scalability framework ensuring fast response times, high throughput, and elastic scaling to support growing healthcare operations and user demands. The system is designed to handle increasing loads, maintain optimal performance under peak usage, and scale seamlessly to accommodate growth while providing responsive user experiences.
epic.technicalArchitecture:
## Technical Architecture Components

- Load balancing and auto-scaling infrastructure
- Caching layer (Redis, CDN)
- Database optimization and read replicas
- Content Delivery Network (CDN)
- Application performance monitoring (APM)
- Database connection pooling
- Asynchronous processing queue
- Multi-tenant architecture
epic.implementationTimeline:
## Implementation Timeline

**Month 1:**
- Performance baseline and optimization

**Month 2:**
- Caching and CDN implementation

**Month 3:**
- Auto-scaling and load balancing

**Month 4:**
- Database optimization and read replicas

**Ongoing:**
- Performance monitoring and continuous optimization
epic.caseStudyReference:
## Case Study Reference

**Large Healthcare Network**

- **Challenge:** Slow response times, system crashes during peak hours
- **Outcome:** 90% improvement in response times, 99.9% uptime, seamless scaling to 10x user base

stories.title: Page load time < 2 seconds (95th percentile)
stories.description: Ensure page load time is less than 2 seconds for 95% of page loads to provide fast, responsive user experience and maintain user engagement.

stories.title: API response time < 500ms (average)
stories.description: Maintain average API response time under 500ms to ensure fast data retrieval and smooth application interactions.

stories.title: Search query < 1 second for 10M+ records
stories.description: Complete search queries in less than 1 second even when searching across 10 million or more records to provide fast information retrieval.

stories.title: Report generation < 10 seconds for standard reports
stories.description: Generate standard reports in less than 10 seconds to enable timely access to business intelligence and operational insights.

stories.title: Support 1000 concurrent users per clinic
stories.description: Support 1000 concurrent users per clinic without performance degradation to accommodate large healthcare organizations and peak usage periods.

stories.title: Process 100 transactions/second (TPS)
stories.description: Process 100 transactions per second to handle high-volume operations including appointments, billing, and clinical data entry.

stories.title: Handle 10,000 API calls/minute
stories.description: Handle 10,000 API calls per minute to support high-frequency integrations, mobile apps, and third-party system connections.

stories.title: Batch processing: 1M records/hour
stories.description: Process 1 million records per hour in batch operations to support large data imports, exports, and bulk processing tasks.

stories.title: Horizontal scaling (add servers on demand)
stories.description: Support horizontal scaling by adding servers on demand to increase capacity and handle growing workloads without service interruption.

stories.title: Auto-scaling based on CPU/memory utilization
stories.description: Implement auto-scaling that automatically adjusts server capacity based on CPU and memory utilization to optimize resource usage and costs.

stories.title: Database read replicas for query distribution
stories.description: Deploy database read replicas to distribute read queries and improve query performance while reducing load on the primary database.

stories.title: Multi-tenant architecture with data isolation
stories.description: Implement multi-tenant architecture with complete data isolation to support multiple clinics or organizations on a single platform while ensuring data security and privacy.
